dataset_id: Arctic Tundra Flux Study in the Kuparuk River Basin (Alaska), 1994-1996
title: Arctic Tundra Flux Study in the Kuparuk River Basin (Alaska), 1994-1996
summary: CO2 and water vapor fluxes and ecosystem characteristics were measured at 24 sites along a 317-km transect from the Arctic coast to the latitudinal treeline in Alaska during the growing seasons of 1994-1996.

cmr.title: Arctic Tundra Flux Study in the Kuparuk River Basin (Alaska), 1994-1996
cmr.summary: CO2 and water vapor fluxes and ecosystem characteristics were measured at 24 sites along a 317-km transect from the Arctic coast to the latitudinal treeline in Alaska during the growing seasons of 1994-1996.
cmr.description: CO2 and water vapor fluxes and ecosystem characteristics were measured at 24 sites along a 317-km transect from the Arctic coast to the latitudinal treeline in Alaska during the growing seasons of 1994-1996.
cmr.Instrument: EDDY CORRELATION DEVICES, PYRANOMETERS, NET RADIOMETERS, IRGA, HUMIDITY SENSORS, THERMISTORS, BAROMETERS, SONIC ANEMOMETER, LICOR QUANTUM SENSOR
cmr.ScienceKeywords1: EARTH SCIENCE@ATMOSPHERE@ATMOSPHERIC CHEMISTRY@CARBON AND HYDROCARBON COMPOUNDS@CARBON DIOXIDE

citation: Eugster, W., J.P. McFadden, and F. Stuart Chapin. 2005. Differences in Surface Roughness, Energy, and CO2Fluxes in Two Moist Tundra Vegetation Types, Kuparuk Watershed, Alaska, U.S.A. Arctic, Antarctic, and Alpine Research. 37(1):61-67.
